name: Network | OAM | Enter Session
description: Client has entered the OAM session

en.subject_template: The client on interface {{interface}} has entered the OAM session
en.body_template: The client on interface {{interface}} has entered the OAM session
en.probable_causes: Ethernet OAM client on the specified interface has detected a remote client and has entered the OAM session.

name: Network | OAM | Exit Session
description: Client has left the OAM session

en.subject_template: The client on interface {{interface}} has left the OAM session
en.body_template: The client on interface {{interface}} has left the OAM session
en.probable_causes: Ethernet OAM client on the specified interface has experienced some state change.

name: Network | OAM | Client Recieved Remote Failure
description: Client has received a remote failure indication from its remote peer

en.subject_template: The client on interface {{interface}} has received a remote failure indication from its remote peer
en.body_template:
The client on interface {{interface}} has received a remote failure indication from its remote peer{% if reason %}
Failure reason: {{reason}}{% endif %}
en.probable_causes: The remote client indicates a Link Fault, or a Dying Gasp (an unrecoverable local failure), or a Critical Event in the OAMPDU. In the event of Link Fault, the Fnetwork administrator may consider shutting down the link.
en.recommended_actions: In the event of a link fault, consider shutting down the link.

name: Network | OAM | Client Clear Remote Failure
description: Client has received a message to clear remote failure indication from its remote peer

en.subject_template: The client on interface {{interface}} has clear remote failure indication from its remote peer
en.body_template:
The client on interface {{interface}} has clear remote failure indication from its remote peer{% if reason %}
Failure reason: {{reason}}{% endif %}
en.probable_causes: The remote client received a message to clear a link fault, or a dying gasp (an unrecoverable local failure), or a critical event in the operations, administration, and maintenance Protocol Data Unit (OAMPDU).
A monitored error has been detected to have crossed the user-specified threshold.
